intro: Jonesia triandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often cultivated for ornamental purposes. Jonesia triandra thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
